verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me: and behold a basket of summer fruit.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD showed me: a basket of ripe summer fruit.

verses.kjv: And he said, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then said the LORD unto me, The end is come upon my people of Israel; I will not again pass by them any more.
verses.ct: He asked, "Amos, what do you see?" I answered, "A basket of ripe summer fruit." Then the LORD told me, "The end has arrived for my people Israel. I will never overlook their sins again."

verses.kjv: And the songs of the temple shall be howlings in that day, saith the Lord GOD: there shall be many dead bodies in every place; they shall cast them forth with silence.
verses.ct: "On that day, the temple songs will turn into wailing," declares the Lord GOD. "Dead bodies will be everywhere. They will be thrown out in silence."

verses.kjv: Hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor of the land to fail,
verses.ct: Listen to this, you who trample the needy and destroy the poor of the land.

verses.kjv: Saying, When will the new moon be gone, that we may sell corn? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making the ephah small, and the shekel great, and falsifying the balances by deceit?
verses.ct: You say, "When will the religious holiday be over so we can sell grain? When will the Sabbath end so we can market our wheat?" — all while shrinking the measuring basket, inflating the price, and rigging the scales to cheat people.

verses.kjv: That we may buy the poor for silver, and the needy for a pair of shoes; yea, and sell the refuse of the wheat?
verses.ct: You buy the poor with silver and the needy for the price of a pair of sandals, and you even sell the leftover scraps of wheat.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath sworn by the excellency of Jacob, Surely I will never forget any of their works.
verses.ct: The LORD has sworn by the pride of Jacob, "I will never forget a single thing they have done."

verses.kjv: Shall not the land tremble for this, and every one mourn that dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholly as a flood; and it shall be cast out and drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.
verses.ct: Won't the land shake because of this? Won't everyone living in it grieve? The whole land will rise like the Nile River, churning and surging, then sinking back down like the flooding of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord GOD, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the earth in the clear day:
verses.ct: "On that day," declares the Lord GOD, "I will make the sun set at noon and bring darkness over the earth in broad daylight."

verses.kjv: And I will turn your feasts into mourning, and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins, and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son, and the end thereof as a bitter day.
verses.ct: "I will turn your festivals into funerals and all your songs into weeping. I will put rough sackcloth on every waist and shave every head bare. I will make it like mourning for an only child, and its conclusion will be a day of utter bitterness."

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the Lord GOD, that I will send a famine in the land, not a famine of bread, nor a thirst for water, but of hearing the words of the LORD:
verses.ct: "Pay attention — the days are coming," declares the Lord GOD, "when I will send a famine across the land — not a shortage of food or water, but a famine of hearing the words of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And they shall wander from sea to sea, and from the north even to the east, they shall run to and fro to seek the word of the LORD, and shall not find it.
verses.ct: People will stagger from sea to sea and roam from north to east, searching desperately for the word of the LORD, but they will not find it.

verses.kjv: In that day shall the fair virgins and young men faint for thirst.
verses.ct: On that day, even the beautiful young women and the strong young men will collapse from thirst.

verses.kjv: They that swear by the sin of Samaria, and say, Thy god, O Dan, liveth; and, The manner of Beersheba liveth; even they shall fall, and never rise up again.
verses.ct: Those who swear by the idol of Samaria, who say, "As surely as your god lives, Dan!" and "As surely as the god of Beersheba lives!" — they will fall and never get up again.
